description: Calendly is an appointment scheduling tool that automates meeting invitations, availability checks, and reminders, helping individuals and teams avoid email back-and-forth

tools.name: CALENDLY_CANCEL_EVENT
tools.description: Permanently cancels an existing, active scheduled event by its `uuid`, optionally providing a `reason`, which may trigger notifications to invitees.

inputSchema.title: CancelEventRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the event to be canceled.

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: Reason for canceling the event; may be included in the cancellation notification to the invitee.

inputSchema.description: Defines the parameters for canceling a scheduled event.

tools.name: CALENDLY_CREATE_INVITEE_NO_SHOW
tools.description: Marks an Invitee, identified by their existing and valid URI, as a 'No Show' for a scheduled event.

inputSchema.title: CreateInviteeNoShowRequest

invitee.title: Invitee
invitee.description: URI of the Invitee to be marked as a no-show.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for marking an Invitee as a no-show.

tools.name: CALENDLY_CREATE_ONE_OFF_EVENT_TYPE
tools.description: Creates a temporary Calendly one-off event type for unique meetings outside regular availability, requiring valid host/co-host URIs, a future date/range for `date_setting`, and a positive `duration`.

inputSchema.title: CreateOneOffEventTypeRequest

host.title: Host
host.description: The URI of the user who will be the host of the one-off event

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the one-off event type

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Duration of the event in minutes

kind.title: Kind
kind.description: Type of location for the event. Determines how the meeting will be conducted.

location.title: Location
location.description: Location string required when kind is 'custom'. Must be a non-empty string.

connected.title: Connected
connected.description: Whether the location service is connected to the host's account. Required for conference-type locations like Zoom, Google Meet, etc.

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: IANA timezone identifier for the event scheduling. Determines how times are interpreted and displayed to invitees.

date_setting.title: DateRangeSetting

type.title: Type
type.description: Must be 'date_range' for this setting type

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: End date for event availability in YYYY-MM-DD format

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: Start date for event availability in YYYY-MM-DD format

date_setting.description: Date range setting for events available within a specific date range.

inputSchema.description: Request model for creating a one-off event type.

tools.name: CALENDLY_CREATE_SCHEDULING_LINK
tools.description: Create a single-use scheduling link. Creates a scheduling link that can be used to book an event. The link allows invitees to schedule up to the specified maximum number of events. Once the limit is reached, the link becomes inactive.

inputSchema.title: CreateSchedulingLinkRequest

max_event_count.title: Max Event Count
max_event_count.description: The max number of events that can be scheduled using this scheduling link. Must be exactly 1 for single-use scheduling links.

inputSchema.description: Request model for creating a single-use scheduling link.

tools.name: CALENDLY_CREATE_SHARE
tools.description: Creates a customizable, one-time share link for a Calendly event type, allowing specific overrides to its settings (e.g., duration, availability, location) without altering the original event type.

inputSchema.title: CreateShareRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Custom name for the shared link; defaults to event type name if unspecified.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Custom event duration in minutes, overriding event type default.

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: End date (YYYY-MM-DD) for shared link availability; required if `period_type` is 'fixed'.

event_type.title: Event Type
event_type.description: URI of the event type to base this share on.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: Start date (YYYY-MM-DD) for shared link availability; required if `period_type` is 'fixed'.

period_type.title: Period Type
period_type.description: Availability period type: 'available_moving' (shows actual available slots for `max_booking_time` days), 'moving' (available for `max_booking_time` days), 'fixed' (within `start_date`/`end_date`), 'unlimited'.

hide_location.title: Hide Location
hide_location.description: If true, hides event location until booking (only if event type has a single custom location).

duration_options.title: Duration Options
duration_options.description: Alternative selectable durations in minutes, overriding event type options.

max_booking_time.title: Max Booking Time
max_booking_time.description: Max days in advance an invitee can book; required if `period_type` is 'moving' or 'available_moving'.

items.title: LocationConfiguration

kind.title: Kind
kind.description: Type of location. Common values include 'physical', 'zoom_conference', 'google_conference', 'microsoft_teams_conference', 'custom', 'ask_invitee'.

location.title: Location
location.description: Specific location details like address, phone number, or meeting room

additional_info.title: Additional Info
additional_info.description: Additional information about the location, such as instructions or details

items.description: Location override configuration for the shared event.

location_configurations.title: Location Configurations
location_configurations.description: Custom location settings that override the event type's default locations. Each configuration specifies a location type and associated details.

items.title: AvailabilityRule

type.title: Type
type.description: Rule type – must be the literal string `'wday'`

wday.title: Wday
wday.description: Day of the week (field name **'wday'**, not 'weekday').

items.title: TimeInterval

to.title: To
to.description: **Key must be exactly 'to'** – end time in 24-hour HH:MM format.

from.title: From
from.description: **Key must be exactly 'from'** – start time in 24-hour HH:MM format.

items.description: Time interval specification for availability windows.

intervals.title: Intervals
intervals.description: List of time intervals when the host is available on this weekday. Empty list means unavailable all day.

items.description: Custom availability rule for specific weekdays and time intervals.

availability__rule__rules.title: Availability  Rule  Rules
availability__rule__rules.description: List of custom availability rules that override the event type's default schedule. Provide an array of objects EACH containing: `type`=`'wday'`, `wday` (weekday), and `intervals` (list of `{from, to}` times). Field names are case-sensitive – use **`wday`, `from`, `to`** exactly. Must be combined with `availability_rule_timezone`.

availability__rule__timezone.title: Availability  Rule  Timezone
availability__rule__timezone.description: IANA timezone (e.g., 'America/New_York') for custom availability rules. Required with `availability_rule_rules`.

inputSchema.description: Request to create a customized, one-time share link for an event type.

tools.name: CALENDLY_CREATE_SINGLE_USE_SCHEDULING_LINK
tools.description: Creates a one-time, single-use scheduling link for an active Calendly event type, expiring after one booking.

inputSchema.title: CreateSingleUseSchedulingLinkRequest

owner.title: Owner
owner.description: The URI of the Calendly Event Type that will own this single-use scheduling link. This Event Type's settings (e.g., duration, availability) will apply to the scheduled meeting.

owner_type.title: Owner Type
owner_type.description: Identifies the owner resource type, which is 'EventType'.

max_event_count.title: Max Event Count
max_event_count.description: The maximum number of events that can be scheduled using this link. For a single-use link, this value must be 1.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `CreateSingleUseSchedulingLink`

tools.name: CALENDLY_CREATE_WEBHOOK_SUBSCRIPTION
tools.description: Creates a Calendly webhook subscription to notify a specified `url` (which must be a publicly accessible HTTPS endpoint) for selected `events` within a given `organization` and `scope`.

inputSchema.title: CreateWebhookSubscriptionRequest

url.title: Url
url.description: Publicly accessible and active callback URL to receive POST requests for subscribed events.

user.title: User
user.description: URI of the user for the webhook; required if 'scope' is 'user'.

group.title: Group
group.description: URI of the group for the webhook; required if 'scope' is 'group'.

signing_key.title: Signing Key
signing_key.description: Optional secret key (6-24 characters) for signing webhook events to verify their authenticity.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: URI of the organization for the webhook.

inputSchema.description: Request for creating a webhook subscription for Calendly event notifications.

tools.name: CALENDLY_DELETE_INVITEE_DATA
tools.description: Permanently removes all invitee data associated with the provided emails from past organization events, for data privacy compliance (requires Enterprise subscription; deletion may take up to one week).

inputSchema.title: DeleteInviteeDataRequest

emails.title: Emails
emails.description: Invitee email addresses for whom all associated data will be permanently removed.

inputSchema.description: Specifies the emails of invitees whose data should be removed.

tools.name: CALENDLY_DELETE_INVITEE_NO_SHOW
tools.description: Deletes an Invitee No-Show record by its `uuid` to reverse an invitee's 'no-show' status; the `uuid` must refer to an existing record.

inputSchema.title: DeleteInviteeNoShowRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the Invitee No-Show record to be removed.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `DeleteInviteeNoShow`

tools.name: CALENDLY_DELETE_SCHEDULED_EVENT_DATA
tools.description: For Enterprise users, initiates deletion of an organization's scheduled event data between a `start_time` and `end_time` (inclusive, where `start_time` must be <= `end_time`); actual data deletion may take up to 7 days to complete.

inputSchema.title: DeleteScheduledEventDataRequest

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Defines the end of the data deletion period (UTC). Events ending at or before this time will be included. Must be within the past 24 months.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Defines the start of the data deletion period (UTC). Events starting at or after this time will be included. Must be within the past 24 months.

inputSchema.description: Request to delete scheduled event data within a specified time range.

tools.name: CALENDLY_DELETE_WEBHOOK_SUBSCRIPTION
tools.description: Deletes an existing webhook subscription to stop Calendly sending event notifications to its registered callback URL; this operation is idempotent.

inputSchema.title: DeleteWebhookSubscriptionRequest

webhook_uuid.title: Webhook Uuid
webhook_uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the webhook subscription to be deleted.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `DeleteWebhookSubscription` action, used to specify the webhook to be deleted.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_CURRENT_USER
tools.description: Retrieves detailed information about the currently authenticated Calendly user.

inputSchema.title: GetCurrentUserRequest
inputSchema.description: Request model for retrieving information about the current Calendly user.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_EVENT
tools.description: Use to retrieve a specific Calendly scheduled event by its UUID, provided the event exists in the user's Calendly account.

inputSchema.title: GetEventRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the Calendly event.

inputSchema.description: Input for retrieving a specific Calendly event.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_EVENT_INVITEE
tools.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific invitee of a scheduled event, using their unique UUIDs.

inputSchema.title: GetEventInviteeRequest

event_uuid.title: Event Uuid
event_uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the scheduled event.

invitee_uuid.title: Invitee Uuid
invitee_uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the invitee for the specified event.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `GetEventInvitee`

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_EVENT_TYPE
tools.description: Retrieves details for a specific Calendly event type, identified by its UUID, which must be valid and correspond to an existing event type.

inputSchema.title: GetEventTypeRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: Unique identifier (UUID) for the event type.

inputSchema.description: Retrieves a specific event type by its UUID.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_GROUP
tools.description: Retrieves all attributes of a specific Calendly group by its UUID; the group must exist.

inputSchema.title: GetGroupRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the Calendly group.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `GetGroup`

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_GROUP_RELATIONSHIP
tools.description: Retrieves a specific Calendly group relationship by its valid and existing UUID, providing details on user-group associations and membership.

inputSchema.title: GetGroupRelationshipRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the group relationship to be retrieved.

inputSchema.description: Request to retrieve a specific group relationship by its UUID.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_INVITEE_NO_SHOW
tools.description: Retrieves details for a specific Invitee No Show record by its UUID; an Invitee No Show is marked when an invitee does not attend a scheduled event.

inputSchema.title: GetInviteeNoShowRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the Invitee No Show record to retrieve.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving details about a specific Invitee No Show.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_ORGANIZATION_INVITATION
tools.description: Retrieves a specific Calendly organization invitation using its UUID and the parent organization's UUID.

inputSchema.title: GetOrganizationInvitationRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the specific organization invitation to retrieve.

org_uuid.title: Org Uuid
org_uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the Calendly organization to which the invitation belongs.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving a specific Calendly organization invitation.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_ORGANIZATION_MEMBERSHIP
tools.description: Retrieves a specific Calendly organization membership by its UUID, returning all its attributes.

inputSchema.title: GetOrganizationMembershipRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the organization membership to retrieve.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving a specific organization membership.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_ROUTING_FORM
tools.description: Retrieves a specific routing form by its UUID, providing its configuration details including questions and routing logic.

inputSchema.title: GetRoutingFormRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the routing form to retrieve.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving a specific routing form by its UUID.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_USER
tools.description: Retrieves comprehensive details for an existing Calendly user.

inputSchema.title: GetUserRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the user. Alternatively, use the literal string "me" to refer to the currently authenticated user (the caller).

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving a specific user by their UUID.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_USER_AVAILABILITY_SCHEDULE
tools.description: Retrieves an existing user availability schedule by its UUID; this schedule defines the user's default hours of availability.

inputSchema.title: GetUserAvailabilityScheduleRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the availability schedule.

inputSchema.description: Request to retrieve a user availability schedule.

tools.name: CALENDLY_GET_WEBHOOK_SUBSCRIPTION
tools.description: Retrieves the details of an existing webhook subscription, identified by its UUID, including its callback URL, subscribed events, scope, and state.

inputSchema.title: GetWebhookSubscriptionRequest

webhook_uuid.title: Webhook Uuid
webhook_uuid.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the webhook subscription to retrieve.

inputSchema.description: Schema for retrieving a webhook subscription by its UUID.

tools.name: CALENDLY_INVITE_USER_TO_ORGANIZATION
tools.description: Invites a user to the specified Calendly organization by email, if they aren't already a member and lack a pending invitation to it.

inputSchema.title: InviteUserToOrganizationRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the organization to which the user will be invited.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the user to be invited to the organization. An invitation link will be sent to this email.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for inviting a user to an organization.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_ACTIVITY_LOG_ENTRIES
tools.description: Retrieves a list of activity log entries for a specified Calendly organization (requires an active Enterprise subscription), supporting filtering, sorting, and pagination.

inputSchema.title: ListActivityLogEntriesRequest

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Specifies the sort order for the results. Provide a list of sort criteria strings, each in the format 'field:direction' (e.g., 'occurred_at:asc'). Valid fields and directions are defined by SortEnm.

actor.title: Actor
actor.description: Filters activity log entries by the users who performed the actions. Provide a list of user URIs.

count.title: Count
count.description: The maximum number of activity log entries to return per page.

action.title: Action
action.description: Filters entries by the specific action performed (e.g., 'user.created', 'event_type.updated'). Provide a list of action strings.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: Filters entries by their category or domain (namespace). Provide a list of namespace strings. Common examples include 'user_management' or 'event_type_management'.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token for pagination, used to fetch the next page of results if the collection spans multiple pages.

search_term.title: Search Term
search_term.description: Filters entries based on the search term. Supported operators: `|` (OR, e.g., `user.created | group.created`), `+` (AND, e.g., `user.created + user.invited`), `" "` (exact phrase, e.g., `"John Doe"`), `-` (exclude term, e.g., `user.created -admin`), `()` (precedence, e.g., `(user.created | user.invited) + team1`), and `*` (prefix search, e.g., `user.email_address:*@example.com`).

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: URI of the Calendly organization for which to retrieve activity log entries.

max_occurred_at.title: Max Occurred At
max_occurred_at.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 UTC format (e.g., '2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z'). Filters entries to include only those that occurred at or before this time.

min_occurred_at.title: Min Occurred At
min_occurred_at.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 UTC format (e.g., '2020-01-02T03:04:05.678Z'). Filters entries to include only those that occurred at or after this time.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `ListActivityLogEntries`

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_EVENT_INVITEES
tools.description: Retrieves a list of invitees for a specified Calendly event UUID, with options to filter by status or email, and sort by creation time.

inputSchema.title: ListEventInviteesRequest

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Order results by the `created_at` field; use 'created_at:asc' for ascending or 'created_at:desc' for descending.

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the event for which to list invitees.

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of invitees to return per page. Default is 20.

email.title: Email
email.description: Filter results by a specific invitee's email address.

status.title: Status
status.description: Filter invitees by their status. Can be 'active' or 'canceled'.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: A token to retrieve the next or previous page of results in a paginated collection.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving a list of invitees for a specific event.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_EVENTS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of scheduled Calendly events. Exactly one of `user`, `organization`, or `group` must be provided to scope the query. The `invitee_email` parameter is a filter and cannot be used as a scope. Admin rights may be needed when filtering by `organization` or `group`.

inputSchema.title: ListEventsRequest

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Sort order for the results. Accepts comma-separated `field:direction` values. Supported field: `start_time`. Supported directions: `asc` (ascending), `desc` (descending).

user.title: User
user.description: URI of the user whose events you want to list. Exactly ONE of `user`, `organization`, or `group` must be supplied to scope the query. Cannot be used together with `invitee_email` as a scope filter.

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of events to return per page.

group.title: Group
group.description: URI of the group (team) whose events you want to list. Exactly ONE of `user`, `organization`, or `group` must be provided to scope the query.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token for pagination to retrieve the next or previous set of results from the collection.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: URI of the organization whose events you want to list. Exactly ONE of `user`, `organization`, or `group` is required. Admin privileges may be required.

invitee_email.title: Invitee Email
invitee_email.description: Invitee's email address to filter events by. This is a filter parameter and cannot be used as a scope. Exactly one of `user`, `organization`, or `group` must be provided to scope the query.

max_start_time.title: Max Start Time
max_start_time.description: Include events with start times at or before this UTC timestamp (e.g., '2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z').

min_start_time.title: Min Start Time
min_start_time.description: Include events with start times at or after this UTC timestamp (e.g., '2020-01-02T03:04:05.678123Z').

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `ListEvents` to retrieve a list of scheduled Calendly events.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_EVENT_TYPE_AVAILABLE_TIMES
tools.description: Fetches available time slots for a Calendly event type within a specified time range; results are not paginated.

inputSchema.title: ListEventTypeAvailableTimesRequest

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: End datetime (exclusive) of the requested availability range, in UTC ISO 8601 format (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ'). The duration between start_time and end_time cannot exceed 7 days.

event_type.title: Event Type
event_type.description: The URI of the event type for which to find available times. This can be obtained by listing event types or from an event type object.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Start datetime (inclusive) of the requested availability range, in UTC ISO 8601 format (e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ').

inputSchema.description: Request model for fetching available times for a Calendly event type.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_EVENT_TYPE_HOSTS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of hosts (users) assigned to a specific, existing Calendly event type, identified by its URI.

inputSchema.title: ListEventTypeHostsRequest

count.title: Count
count.description: Number of event type hosts to return per page.

event_type.title: Event Type
event_type.description: URI of an existing event type for which to list hosts.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token from a previous list call to get the next/previous page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `ListEventTypeHosts`

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_GROUP_RELATIONSHIPS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of group relationships defining an owner's role (e.g., member, admin) within a group; an owner can have one membership per group but multiple admin roles across different groups.

inputSchema.title: ListGroupRelationshipsRequest

owner.title: Owner
owner.description: Filter results by owner URI (Organization Membership or Invitation URI).

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token for retrieving a specific page of results, obtained from `next_page_token` or `previous_page_token` in a previous response.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for listing group relationships, allowing pagination and filtering.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_GROUPS
tools.description: Returns a list of groups for a specified Calendly organization URI, supporting pagination.

inputSchema.title: ListGroupsRequest

count.title: Count
count.description: The maximum number of groups to return per page. The value can range from 1 to 100.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: A token to retrieve a specific page of results. Pass this value from a previous response's 'next_page_token' to fetch the next set of groups, or 'previous_page_token' for the previous set.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: The URI of the organization to filter groups by. For example, 'https://api.calendly.com/organizations/ORGANIZATION_UUID'.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving a list of groups associated with an organization.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_ORGANIZATION_INVITATIONS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of invitations for a specific organization, identified by its UUID.

inputSchema.title: ListOrganizationInvitationsRequest

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Order of results by field(s) and direction (asc/desc); e.g., 'created_at:asc' or 'email:desc,status:asc'.

count.title: Count
count.description: Number of results to return per page.

email.title: Email
email.description: Filter by the recipient's email address.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Pagination token to access a specific page of results.

inputSchema.description: Parameters for listing organization invitations.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_ORGANIZATION_MEMBERSHIPS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of organization memberships.

inputSchema.title: ListOrganizationMembershipsRequest

user.title: User
user.description: Filter memberships by the URI of the user. For example, 'https://api.calendly.com/users/USER_UUID'.

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of membership records to return per page. Must be an integer between 1 and 100, inclusive.

email.title: Email
email.description: Filter memberships by the email address of the user. For example, 'user@example.com'.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: The token to retrieve the next or previous page of results in a paginated collection.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: Filter memberships by the URI of the organization. For example, 'https://api.calendly.com/organizations/ORGANIZATION_UUID'.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for listing organization memberships, allowing pagination and filtering by email, organization, or user.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_OUTGOING_COMMUNICATIONS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of outgoing SMS communications for a specified organization; requires an Enterprise subscription and if filtering by creation date, both `min_created_at` and `max_created_at` must be provided to form a valid range.

inputSchema.title: ListOutgoingCommunicationsRequest

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of records to return per page. Must be between 1 and 100, inclusive.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results. Provided in the `next_page_token` field of a previous response.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: The URI of the organization whose outgoing communications are to be retrieved.

max_created_at.title: Max Created At
max_created_at.description: Include outgoing communications that were created before this timestamp. Formatted as "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ" in UTC.

min_created_at.title: Min Created At
min_created_at.description: Include outgoing communications that were created after this timestamp. Formatted as "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ" in UTC.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `ListOutgoingCommunications`

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_ROUTING_FORMS
tools.description: Retrieves routing forms for a specified organization; routing forms are questionnaires used to direct invitees to appropriate booking pages or external URLs.

inputSchema.title: ListRoutingFormsRequest

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Specifies the order of results. Use a comma-separated list of `field:direction` pairs. Supported field: `created_at`. Supported directions: `asc` (ascending), `desc` (descending).

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of routing forms to return per page.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token to retrieve a specific page of results, usually from a previous response's pagination details.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: The URI of the organization for which to retrieve routing forms.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving a list of routing forms.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_USER_AVAILABILITY_SCHEDULES
tools.description: Retrieves all availability schedules for the specified Calendly user.

inputSchema.title: ListUserAvailabilitySchedulesRequest

user.title: User
user.description: URI of the user whose availability schedules are to be listed; must be a valid Calendly user URI.

inputSchema.description: Request to retrieve all availability schedules for a specified Calendly user.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_USER_BUSY_TIMES
tools.description: Fetches a user's busy time intervals (internal and external calendar events) in ascending order for a period up to 7 days; keyset pagination is not supported.

inputSchema.title: ListUserBusyTimesRequest

user.title: User
user.description: The URI of the user whose busy times are being queried. This is typically the user's Calendly API URI.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: The end of the time range for which to fetch busy times, in RFC3339 format (e.g., '2023-10-26T11:00:00Z'). Must be after start_time.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The start of the time range for which to fetch busy times, in RFC3339 format (e.g., '2023-10-26T10:00:00Z').

inputSchema.description: Request schema for fetching a user's busy time intervals from Calendly.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_USER_S_EVENT_TYPES
tools.description: Retrieves event types for a user or organization; requires either the `user` or `organization` URI.

inputSchema.title: ListUserSEventTypesRequest

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Order results by field(s) and direction ('asc' or 'desc'), e.g., 'name:asc,created_at:desc'. Supported fields: name, position, created_at, updated_at.

user.title: User
user.description: URI of the **user** whose event types to list. Provide **either** `user` **or** `organization` (exactly one is required).

count.title: Count
count.description: Number of event types per page (max 100).

active.title: Active
active.description: Filter by active status (true for active, false for inactive). If omitted, all event types are returned.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token for retrieving the next or previous page of event types.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: URI of the **organization** whose event types to list. Provide **either** `organization` **or** `user` (exactly one is required).

admin_managed.title: Admin Managed
admin_managed.description: Filter by admin management: true for admin-managed only, false to exclude admin-managed. If omitted, all types are returned (respecting other filters).

user_availability_schedule.title: User Availability Schedule
user_availability_schedule.description: URI of the user's availability schedule; use with `user` to filter event types by this primary schedule. Example: 'https://api.calendly.com/user_availability_schedules/SCHEDULE_UUID'.

inputSchema.description: Lists event types for a user or organization.

tools.name: CALENDLY_LIST_WEBHOOK_SUBSCRIPTIONS
tools.description: Retrieves webhook subscriptions for a Calendly organization; `scope` determines if `user` or `group` URI is also required for filtering.

inputSchema.title: ListWebhookSubscriptionsRequest

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Sort order for results (e.g., 'created_at:asc'). Supported fields: `created_at`, `updated_at`. Supported directions: `asc`, `desc`.

user.title: User
user.description: URI of the Calendly user; required if `scope` is 'user'.

group.title: Group
group.description: URI of the Calendly group; required if `scope` is 'group'.

scope.title: Scope
scope.description: Scope of the webhook subscriptions: 'organization', 'user', or 'group'.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token for paginating to the next or previous page of results.

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: URI of the Calendly organization for which to list webhook subscriptions.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `ListWebhookSubscriptions`

tools.name: CALENDLY_REMOVE_USER_FROM_ORGANIZATION
tools.description: Removes a user (who is not an owner) from an organization by their membership UUID, requiring administrative privileges.

inputSchema.title: RemoveUserFromOrganizationRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier of the organization membership to be removed.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for removing a user from an organization.

tools.name: CALENDLY_REVOKE_USER_S_ORGANIZATION_INVITATION
tools.description: Revokes a pending and revokable (not yet accepted or expired) organization invitation using its UUID and the organization's UUID, rendering the invitation link invalid.

inputSchema.title: RevokeUserSOrganizationInvitationRequest

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identifier of the organization invitation to be revoked.

org_uuid.title: Org Uuid
org_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the organization.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for revoking an organization invitation for a user.
